John Milton.Action: Fires a shotgun through the driver's side window to stop pursuers, showing fearlessness and determination.
Drives a damaged car aggressively to intercept foes, confident in his control.
Aims and fires a shotgun through the driver's side window under high-speed conditions, demonstrating marksmanship and fearlessness.
Guns the Roadrunner away from the truck and engages effectively in a violent confrontation, quickly disarming and incapacitating multiple attackers with precision.
Blows his knee apart from 20 paces but continues to pursue aggressively and maintain control of the situation.
Removes Passenger's wallet and digs cash out immediately after subduing him, demonstrating quick situational awareness and resourcefulness.
Shows no mercy to captors, uses violence without hesitation, steals cash from victim.
Determined to rescue a person despite threats, urges communication of his impending arrival to enemies.
Effectively disables adversaries, including using a shotgun to neutralize threats quickly and decisively.
Extracts critical location information under pressure from a hostile subject.
Demonstrates emotional control by intimidating enemies and issuing clear warnings before departing.
Drops the cell phone after briefly staring at it instead of utilizing it, potentially missing an opportunity for communication or tracking.
Makes eye contact with Mary, the Indian mother, who quickly looks away, indicating a tense or uneasy interaction.
Politely requests coffee from NormaJean and asks for directions; engages in normal social interaction.
Tries to get Mary's attention subtly and engages in conversation about locations important to the situation
Maintains a polite demeanor despite being ignored and exchanged glares
Shows interest in the children's story, responding warmly and with curiosity
Attempts to engage others by asking specific questions about locations important to his goal, showing persistence and focus.
Fails to get immediate cooperation or attention from others (Mary ignoring his stare), indicating limited influence in the moment.
Stares at NormaJean with an impressed smirk, engages in light flirtation but remains somewhat reserved.
Correctly identifies the full moon is three days away despite NormaJean's suggestion otherwise, demonstrating awareness and attention to detail.
Maintains a confident and slightly amused demeanor when interacting with NormaJean, indicating social confidence.
Checks surroundings and assesses the ride situation by glancing at Piper and discussing transportation options, showing situational awareness.
Offers to fix Piper's car and asks for a ride politely.
Leans in to fix the car, smiles, and thanks Piper.
Chuckles good-naturedly when Piper rejects his romantic advance.
Intervenes to stop Frank from assaulting Piper by kicking Frank and attacking him with fists.
Questions Roy's instruction tersely ('Got a problem with that?').
Shares past personal detail with Piper openly (used to drive truck, spent night with a man's wife).
Avoids explaining his sudden stare and discomfort ('I...nothing I guess').
Responds straightforwardly and politely to Candy's offer ('Beer').
Compliments Candy silently, watching her appreciatively.
Plays along with breaking rules lightly and accepts Milk as a drink.
Milton’s gaze returns to Candy; Candy catches his look and smiles.
Responds briefly and somewhat dismissively to Piper's teasing about his past sexual activity.
Asks Piper about her beer, showing casual concern or attentiveness.
Grabs Frank's wrist, shoves him violently into the room, impales him with a bat.
Uses a hypnotic ancient coin to distract Trooper #2, gaining a tactical advantage.
Confidently confronts state troopers and directs their attention with photo and coin, showing calm control in tense situation.
Described by others as highly dangerous and capable of killing, implying a lethal and effective nature.
No direct actions or dialogue from Milton in the excerpt; presence inferred through others' discussion, showing impact but no immediate demonstration of skill or intelligence.
Protects Candy by rolling with her to avoid an attack, uses force to fend off multiple assailants.
Presses Candy's face into his chest, twisting his body to shield her as he fights off attackers.
Fumbles in his bag to find ammunition and continues to protect Candy despite the danger.
Shoots attackers to protect Candy and himself during an intense fight.
Pulls the shotgun man's face with his boot, reloads 357 without hesitation after killing.
Tells Piper to move on quickly after killing two men, showing no remorse or concern.
Grabs Piper and places himself between her and armed Troopers, showing protective quick thinking.
Pulls a gun and opens fire immediately on approaching Troopers.
Despite being hit and wounded, he attempts to prevent Piper from taking an ancient powerful gun, showing awareness of risks.
Says 'Aw fuck' upon recognizing the Troopers, showing momentary frustration but not loss of control.
Vows to protect the woman in the backseat from harm by confronting the Accountant.
Uses lethal force to stop the Accountant without hesitation.
Watches Piper leave without forcing her to stay; acknowledges danger without dismissiveness.
Stops the car to assess the situation calmly after the crash, showing patience and self-control.
Shakes his head to quietly reassure Piper about the identity of the crushed cultist, aiming to reduce her worry.
Shows hesitation before starting the engine to pursue the cultists, indicating awareness and caution.
Reloads his shotgun and 357 methodically despite being injured, showing control and focus.
Demonstrates knowledge of dangerous individuals like Jonah King and details about his daughter's involvement.
Admits he did not know about his daughter's situation for two years due to being locked up, indicating a gap in awareness and intervention.
Tells Piper to stay put and says he won't be long, implying he will handle the situation alone.
Approaches accident scene calmly, holding shotgun but keeping it hidden and aimed cautiously.
Acknowledges the Thin Old Man's comment about the injured possibly being okay before reacting to danger.
Quickly prepares to confront potential threat inside overturned cab (raises shotgun), showing focus on protecting others.
Tells Thin Old Man to let Piper go, calling her a pain in the ass but protecting her.
Drops his shotgun reluctantly under threat.
Calls Jonah King a sick fuck and confronts him over the child’s safety.
Accused of abandoning his daughter and abandoning her to suffering.
Covers his injured eye with Piper's bandanna, showing a symbolic connection or care for Piper.
Engages in violent shootout, firing at pursuers without hesitation.
Drives aggressively, running over an enemy's legs, causing severe injury.
Leans out of the car with a shotgun, fires at enemy vehicle, quickly reloads to take another shot.
Hesitates to take aim after reloading the shotgun, showing momentary doubt.
Struggles to keep the car on the road after being hit by another vehicle, but manages to maintain control.
Distracted by the incoming vehicles and fails to notice the RV pulling off the road, missing a critical clue.
Milton reacts quickly to the attack by snatching his gun, aiming out the back glass, and shooting accurately at the attacker’s vehicle, causing it to lose control.
Despite incoming gunfire hitting his vehicle and spinning him in his seat, Milton maintains composure and floors the accelerator to pursue the escaping RV.
Intervenes to save Piper from Jonah, aiming a shotgun at Jonah to protect her.
Calls Jonah a derogatory name ('dickless') during the confrontation.
Reaches out to help Piper, shows protective care by pulling her close and checking on her after a dangerous situation.
Acknowledges Piper's efforts and reassures her with understanding and solidarity.
Dismisses beliefs in supernatural powers as 'bullshit,' showing skepticism but not necessarily intolerance.
Successfully rescues Piper by catching her as she falls onto the GTO's hood.
Assesses the threat level, knowing Jonah had only about twenty followers and confidently states they hurt him good.
Appears unfazed and determined despite serious injury, showing resilience and focus.
Unable to immediately fix or react to the car's engine failure; the GTO breaks down with smoke and hissing from the engine, suggesting a limitation in technical competence.
Despite the bullet lodged in his head, remains confident and composed, prioritizing the mission over his own condition.
Indirectly causes severe injury to Man With Wig by running him over.
Runs over the Man With Wig, causing severe injury.
Engages in tense but clear communication with Webster over shared past and current mission.
Acknowledges his daughter’s situation when asked, reveals motivation sincerely.
Maintains guarded and defensive stance, carrying a shotgun and confrontational toward Webster.
Offers a comforting smile to Candy and reassures her he won't let anything happen to her.
Stokes a fire quietly, observed by others reflecting on his complexity as a father and husband.
Stokes a fire to keep warm and maintain presence in a difficult situation.
Shown indirectly through others' commentary as a bad husband but a good father who cared deeply.
Vanished the year before his daughter went off to college to keep her safe from dangerous people.
Went alone to confront dangerous enemies to protect others.
Was described as a good father and a good friend by Webster.
Expresses emotional pain about seeing the suffering of loved ones while being powerless to help.
Went alone to confront dangerous enemies to protect his daughter, indicating courage and capability.
Successfully escaped a deadly situation involving powerful enemies, demonstrating skill and intelligence.
Was willing to vanish to keep his daughter safe, showing strategic planning.
Expresses deep grief about his daughter's death and her husband fighting fiercely for her, shows emotional pain and protective anger.
Uses harsh language and insults the son-in-law’s appearance and character.
Admits concern and apologizes to Piper for putting her in danger.
Determined to keep going despite overwhelming odds, motivated by rescuing his granddaughter.
Quickfires three blasts through the windshield while driving the Nova, effectively navigating a dangerous situation and enabling escape.
Commands 'Shotgun!' and quickly takes the shotgun from Piper, showing quick decision-making and readiness.
Reassures Piper that their pursuers are scared of her, showing protective attitude.
Instructs Piper to stay behind while he approaches the danger alone.
Threatens the Accountant to protect Piper, showing willingness to confront danger.
Drops his weapon and verbally thanks the Accountant to save Piper, showing concern for her safety.
Internalizes alarm and concern about being outnumbered but focuses on protecting Piper.
Chuckles and casually admits to stealing the God-Killer, downplaying the danger.
Asks sincerely why the Accountant helped him, showing some openness and curiosity.
Presses the Accountant to help save Piper, showing determination but ignores the refusal.
Tells the Accountant to get off his car, asserting control in a tense situation.
Runs down any that get in his way, shoots a man at close range without hesitation.
Crawls bleeding toward the ancient revolver to defend against Jonah King, showing determination to protect others.
Places himself in harm’s way to confront a threat to the baby and Skanky Gal.
Stares at the baby, recognizes her innocence and beauty, and places her in Piper's arms with a request to keep her safe.
Acknowledges Piper's protective nature and trusts her to defend the baby, showing faith in others' good intentions.
Asks Piper to love and care for the baby in his stead, expressing a deep but selfless emotional connection.
Says he is 'asking more than he has a right to,' showing humility and awareness, but also concern for others' feelings.
Sits up slowly despite physical pain and fatigue, shows resilience and readiness by engaging in conversation and standing with help.
Demonstrates awareness of his own limitations and acknowledges he cannot be killed as he is already dead, indicating clear self-understanding and confidence.
Emerges slow and sure from wreckage, confronts hostile attackers decisively and violently, takes money from defeated enemy.
Offers hand and gives a smile to Piper, expressing gratitude for the ride.
Tosses his duffle over his shoulder and offers a polite smile and handshake to Piper, showing calmness and social ease.
Crosses toward the phone booth confidently and uses it, implying purposeful action.
Interrupts a violent assault by kicking Frank under the chin and overpowering him with punches to protect Piper.
Calmly confronts the rule about ID for drink orders and cleverly gets the waitress to break the rules by charming her.
Responds vaguely and evasively when questioned about his past or what is wrong, suggesting controlled internal behavior.
Does not argue or react aggressively when told to leave by Roy, instead choosing to stay calmly overnight.
Letting the waitress handle the situation with his expired license without pressing the issue himself, relying on charm.
Distracted, not immediately aware of surroundings, engages in casual conversation rather than focused action.
Calmly and decisively subdues Frank with superior physical force and control, showing skill and confidence in a dangerous confrontation.
Maintains interrogation under physical threat, effectively coercing information from the injured Frank.
Pounds the wall in frustration and shouts back at Piper
Engages in sexual activity with Candy without apparent care for Piper's irritation
Engages confidently in a sexually charged, competitive exchange with Piper, matching her intensity and not showing hesitation or insecurity.
Responds quickly and assertively to Piper pounding the wall, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Despite the intense situation, he maintains focus and readiness to react to external disturbances (not explicitly shown but implied by the tension and exchange).
Places himself between Piper and the State Troopers to protect her, taking the lead in a dangerous situation.
Urgently stops Piper from using a particular old gun, indicating concern and protection.
Insists on driving despite being injured, shows concern for Piper's safety.
Acknowledges danger and responsibility honestly to Piper.
Engages in deadly violence without hesitation.
Shoots Trooper #2 accurately in the ear, kills both threatening cops.
Struggles toward the GTO but insists on driving despite injury, showing confidence in his own skills.
Quickly assesses that the cops were trying to kill them rather than arrest, demonstrating situational awareness.
Floors the GTO and takes control of the dangerous escape, showing confident driving under pressure.
Says 'Both' in response to being hunter and hunted, indicating self-awareness and acceptance of complex reality.
Manages to stop the out-of-control GTO before it slams into the guard rail despite fighting with the wheel.
Breathes a sigh and assesses the situation calmly after stopping the car, showing presence of mind.
Hesitates momentarily before starting the engine again, indicating brief uncertainty or caution.
Confronts Jonah King publicly to defend his granddaughter and accuses Jonah of harming his daughter, exposing Jonah's cruelty in front of others.
Shows deep protective instincts toward his granddaughter and daughter by standing up to powerful adversaries.
Uses harsh language and insults (e.g., 'sonofabitch', 'shithead') in his confrontation.
Despite the danger and provocation, Milton focuses on protecting family rather than escalating violence impulsively.
Offers to let the antagonist live if he returns his granddaughter.
Continues to fight aggressively after being shot, shoots a man in the head.
Violently ejects the car door at Teen #2, nearly injuring him with no apology or concern.
Dismisses Teen #2's fear and downplays the near injury with a cold remark about when they will meet again, showing no empathy.

The Accountant (an apparent alias/role) confidently exits the cruiser after a sudden attack, brushes himself off, and addresses the teenagers with precise predictions about their futures, then walks away calmly.
Uses a door as a weapon to launch an unexpected and powerful attack, demonstrating precision and control.
Shows no hesitation or confusion after the attack, maintaining composure and clear focus on his mission.
Slams on brakes after missing turn off, showing quick reaction to unexpected event.
Swerves and accelerates skillfully to maneuver around obstacles and during a high-speed chase.
Drives the GTO over Business Woman, taking a calculated risk to avoid her and continue pursuit despite pain.
Engages in violent shootout while protecting himself during chase.
Allows Piper to clean his wound and accepts care without complaint.
Positions himself protectively in front of Piper when a vehicle approaches, preparing to defend her.
Conceals a shotgun skillfully behind his back to maintain the element of surprise and stay ready for confrontation.
Confidently challenges Webster to draw his weapon first, demonstrating control over the situation and confidence in his abilities.
Exchanges calm but assertive dialogue showing awareness of the stakes (his daughter being taken) and a clear purpose for his actions.
Analyzes the fighting ability of the son-in-law, recognizing his skill and determination in battle.
Struggles to speak about emotional pain and loss, going silent.
Expresses strong resolve and determination to kill those responsible, indicating a clear goal and motivation.
Clearly plans to not go alone and insists Piper accompany him, showing awareness of past mistakes and willingness to improve.
Takes control by grabbing shotgun shells and gun and handing them to Piper, demonstrating decisiveness and leadership.
Has Webster stay behind despite his protests, indicating strategic thinking about resource allocation.
Stares silently at Piper initially, suggesting possible difficulty in communication or emotional restraint that could limit teamwork.
Snatches gun and hands it to Piper, then places arm around Webster to walk him out of earshot.
Says Webster is too old and would slow them down and get himself killed.
Admits to Piper that he needs her and that’s no lie, and asks if she is sure about this.
Responds to Piper's insult by simply saying 'I ain't your daddy.'
Notices the approaching police and chooses to not stop, pushing the pedal to the floor despite Piper's protests.
Responds quickly and decisively to danger by cutting the wheel to avoid a collision and protect those in his car.
Uses a fake FBI badge to command authority and control the situation, forcing armed troopers to stand down through confident deception and quick thinking.
Assesses the situation realistically, recognizing he is outnumbered (40 cultists vs expected less than 20).
Slowly walks back toward his vehicle deep in thought, showing deliberate consideration.
Quickly reacts with alarm and aims his revolver at the threat approaching Piper and the Accountant.
Threatens the Accountant with his revolver, clearly understanding the stakes (no heaven, no hell if he shoots).
Drops his weapon and complies under threat to Piper’s life without immediately trying alternative tactics or escape.
Walks in and takes the God-Killer unexpectedly, exploiting others' underestimation of him.
Questions the Accountant intelligently to understand motives behind assistance.
Tries to negotiate help from the Accountant to deal with forty opponents.
Shows no signs of panic or confusion despite dangerous odds.
Drives the Nova aggressively, strategically using the car as a weapon to scatter and crush cultists.
Successfully targets and catches Jonah King in a tense moment, showing awareness and precision.
Despite his 357 running dry, he quickly adapts by using the car to protect himself and counterattack.
Yanks a Magnum from an attacker while maneuvering the car under heavy fire, showing skill and reflexes.
Twists the Magnum gunslinger style and fires it effectively at the Cultist's face.
Runs down any enemies that get in his way, showing aggressive and confident tactical behavior.
Roars in anger while driving the heavily damaged 69 Nova under heavy fire, attempting to maintain control in a chaotic situation.
Fails to keep control of the car after the front tire is blasted, leading the Nova to pinwheel uncontrollably into an oil derrick.
Clambers deep inside the wreck, praying they don't ignite the leaking fuel.
Disappears from the wrecked car, leaving possible danger for pursuers.
Handles the handoff of the baby with care and trust, choosing Piper to keep her safe and expressing confidence in others like Webster to protect them.
Admits to Piper that beating the devil is impossible and accepts limits to his control, showing realistic judgment and clear understanding of the situation.
Struggles physically (head lolling, coughing) but remains focused on protecting the baby and assigning responsibilities.
Eventually accepts his fate and relinquishes control, which shows acceptance rather than failure, indicating competent self-awareness.
